definition: hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
to hang (down)/droop/dangle/bend down/hand down/bequeath/nearly/almost/to approach
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
mourning/funeral/(old) corpse
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: In the evening, the crestfallen little dog walked by a big tree.
sentences.chinese: 在晚上，小狗垂頭喪氣的在大樹前亂動。

sentences.english: Sometimes we are happy and high-spirited. Sometimes we are in low spirits.
sentences.chinese: 有時興高采烈，有時垂頭喪氣。
你垂頭喪氣的。發生什麼事了？
看看這隻垂頭喪氣的禿鷹。

sentences.english: Come out for a walk instead of moping around in the house.
sentences.chinese: 別在房裏垂頭喪氣地打轉，出來散散步吧。

sentences.english: Poplar leaves is not reversed pendulum, and I never dejected life.
sentences.chinese: 白楊樹沒有倒垂的葉片，我也從沒有垂頭喪氣的日子。

sentences.english: The naughty boy walked sadly to the headmaster's office.
sentences.chinese: 這個調皮的男孩子垂頭喪氣的朝校長辦公室走去。

sentences.english: In a few minutes they were paddling sullenly back to the boat .
sentences.chinese: 過了一會，他們便垂頭喪氣地涉水回到小船上。

sentences.english: She noticed that Muffat was sitting resignedly on a narrow divan-bed.
sentences.chinese: 她看見莫法正垂頭喪氣地坐在一張不寬的坐牀上。
漢密爾頓看起來垂頭喪氣。

sentences.english: What happened? You look so crestfallen like it's the end of the world!
sentences.chinese: 怎麼了？你看起來垂頭喪氣的，好像世界末日一樣。

sentences.english: The loser sat slumped in dejection .
sentences.chinese: 失敗者垂頭喪氣地坐着，全身癱軟。

sentences.english: Disheartened, I trudged wearily back to camp each dusk.
sentences.chinese: 每個薄暮十分，我都垂頭喪氣地跋涉回露營地。

sentences.english: I were left crestfallen to the playing.
sentences.chinese: 我垂頭喪氣的朝琴房走去。

sentences.english: He did not get a single fish after going to sea for a whole day, finally back home depressed .
sentences.chinese: 他出海一天也沒有捕到一條魚，垂頭喪氣地回到了家。

sentences.english: I was crestfallen to go home.
sentences.chinese: 我就垂頭喪氣的走回家。

definition: to force someone to do something
red in the face/extremely angry
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
sullen/to scowl miserably
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
bird's nest
out of breath (idiom)/to gasp for air
pinyin: shang4 qi4 bu4 jie1 xia4 qi4

definition: head and face filthy with grime (idiom)/covered in dirt/dejected and depressed
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
